Es por esto que viene trabajando fuertemente y ahora quiere poder exhibir sus productos de una manera que sea más atractivo para sus clientes, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y a la compra de productos de uso personal para surtir su negocio.

Melisa espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y le siga generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus propios gastos y poder cumplir el sueño de pagar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Melisa is a young entrepreneur who has been carrying out commercial activities in her own business since she was very young in order to generate her own income and be able to cover her personal expenses and contribute as much as possible to family income.  While still in high school she sold candy and women’s accessories having permission from the principal and later on after she graduated from high school she signed up with a firm to start selling personal use items via catalogue.  

Currently, Melisa is 18 years old and continues offering her personal use products via catalogue and her business has been growing little by little generating income that she can cover personal expenses with and contributing as much as possible to household income.  Melisa hopes that her business will generate enough income to pay for her university studies and have an economically stable future and greater opportunities for progress.  

This is why she’s been working hard and now wants to be able to display her wares in a more attractive way for her customers so she’s looking for a loan to buy a display case to display her products and to buy personal use products to stock her business.  Melisa hopes in this way that her business will continue to grow and continue generating income needed to cover her own expenses and to be able to reach her dream of paying for her university studies.

loans.use: to buy a display case and personal use products.

loans.name: Basti Guseinova

texts.en:
Basti is 54 years old.  She lives in a small village in the Gardabani District.  Basti lives with her younger sister and 21-year-old son.  

Basti and her sister lead the family’s agricultural business.  They have a plot of land where they grow greens during the year.  Basti sells harvested greens on the local open market.  Basti sells not only her harvest but also greens and vegetables she purchases from neighborhood farms.  The family’s total average monthly income is 1000 GEL. 

Basti has requested a loan to purchase additional greens from neighboring farmers. She will increase the assortment of greens she sells and hopes to attract additional customers at the market.  She hopes this will increase her sales and enable the family to increase their income, which will be used to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase greens for resale.

loans.name: Mauricio Abarca Ureña

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven de 31 años de edad, vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Mauricio  está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para comprar semilla de ñampí, esto es un tubérculo comestible entre los costarricenses y tiene buena demanda en el mercado, esta verdura  se produce principalmente en la zona  donde él vive ,  el trabajo de plantación de este producto requiere de varias personas, por ello usará parte del préstamo en pagar mano de obra .

Mauricio logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, aumentará los ingresos y ayudará con los gastos de su hogar. Su deseo es brindar productos de calidad a sus clientes y para ello comprará insumos para lograr una excelente calidad en  su cultivo .
Mauricio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 31, is a young man living with his family in a community in south Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on farming and animal husbandry activities where planting tubers, coffee, corn and beans and raising livestock predominate.

Mauricio is asking for a ₡600.000 (six-hundred thousand) colones loan to buy ginger seeds.  This is an edible tuber that among Costa Ricans has high market demand.  This vegetable is produced primarily in the zone where he lives.  Work farming this product requires several people so he will use part of the loan to pay labor costs.

Mauricio will manage to improve his and his family’s quality of life, will increase income and will help with household expenses.  His wish is to provide quality products to his customers and to do so will buy supplies to attain an excellent quality crop.

Mauricio is a member of the “Danta S.A.” communal bank one of Costa Rica’s 150 communal credit firms.

loans.use: to buy ginger seeds.

loans.name: Kennedy Ayanje Ayodi

texts.en: Kennedy is 40 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He works as a plumber to earn a living and has been in business for eight years.  He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES in order to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.use: to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.name: Oldemar Quirós Jiménez

texts.es:
Oldemar es un hombre de 41 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Oldemar está solicitando un préstamo de ₡1.000.000 (un millón de colones), para  comprar semilla de frijol , 
abono , fungicidas e insecticidas, para proteger el cultivo , ya que es una alternativa para obtener mayores ingresos. Tiene como meta hacerse productor de semilla para proveer a otros agricultores brindándoles  productos de calidad.

Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con este proyecto , lo cual agradece , ya que así ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, espera seguir utilizando este recurso financiero por mucho tiempo.
Oldemar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oldemar, 41, lives with his family in a community in south Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on farming and animal husbandry activities where planting tubers, coffee, corn and beans and raising livestock predominate.

Oldemar is asking for a ₡1.000.000 (one million) colones loan to buy bean seeds, manure, fungicide and insecticide to protect the crops because it’s an alternative for obtaining higher income.  His goal is to become a seed producer to supply other farmers with quality product.

This is the third loan he’s had with this project which he is grateful for because this is how he’s been able to move his family forward and improve their living conditions; he hopes to continue using this financial resource for a long time.

Oldemar is a member of the “Danta S.A.” communal bank one of Costa Rica’s 150 communal credit firms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Teresa Vasquez

texts.es:
Carmen es una persona que ha tenido una gran fortaleza para superar las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Carmen se encuentra casada y anteriormente su esposo trabajaba en una empresa, y ella también contaba con su empleo en otra empresa; por circunstancias adversas a su voluntad, como recorte de personal y cierre de la empresa, ambos se quedaron sin empleo y se vieron en la obligación de buscar alternativas urgentemente para generar los ingresos en su hogar. Fue así como Carmen decidió montar su negocio el cual es una cafetería donde ofrece a sus clientes diferentes bebidas, snack, y bebidas alcohólicas, y gracias a esto logró superar esta adversidad y seguir progresando en su vida. En su negocio ya lleva un largo tiempo y ha logrado captar una gran clientela gracias a la buena atención que ofrece, y ahora que su negocio requiere de hacerle algunos mantenimientos o remodelaciones, Carmen busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de silletería y compra de una vitrina.

Carmen espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, y espera que su familia pueda seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a person who has had great fortitude to overcome life’s adversities.  Carmen is married and her husband used to work for a firm and she also worked for a different firm.  Due to circumstances beyond her control, like staff cut backs and firm closings, both of them became unemployed and they were forced urgently to find alternative ways to generate household income.  

This was how Carmen decided to set up her business which is a café where she offers her customers various beverages snacks and alcoholic beverages.  Thanks to this she was able to overcome this adversity and continue making progress in her life.

She’s been in business a long time and has managed to capture a large clientele thanks to the good service she provides.  Now that her business needs some upgrading and remodeling, Carmen is looking for a loan that will allow her to buy tables, chairs and to buy a display case.  Carmen hopes in this way to be able to continue generating income needed for her home and hopes that her family will be able to continue to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a display case.

loans.name: Raul De Jesus Nanclares

texts.es:
Raul siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y tenerle mucho amor a su familia. Anteriormente, Raul trabajaba en una empresa y así generaba ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, sin embargo el trabajo era muy inestable y por esto decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio. Raul montó una venta de raspados, o copos de nieve y con esto genera los ingresos para sostener los gastos de su hogar. Ya hace 20 años que Raul viene trabajando en este negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido tener muy buenas ventas, sin embargo, debido a su informalidad, actualmente requiere de realizar algunas mejores que le exigen algunos entes del gobierno para poder seguir trabajando su negocio con las mejores prácticas de manipulación de alimentos. Por esta razón, Raul espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar una nevera donde pueda conservar su hielo, y comprar un motor para su carro y no tener que seguirlo empujando para su traslado.

Raul espera que de esta manera pueda seguir trabajando su negocio con las mejores prácticas de manipulación de alimentos y mejorar su calidad de vida ya que no tendrá que seguir empujando su carro. Además, Raul espera que su negocio le siga generando los ingresos para su familia y en un futuro sueña con montar un negocio de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Raúl has always been noted for being a very hardworking person and for having much love for his family.  Raúl used to be employed by a firm and earned income for his home where he lives with his wife and two children.  However, work was very unstable so he decided to become independent and set up his own business.

Raúl set up a shaved ice business, or ice balls, to generate income to cover his home’s expenses.  Raúl has been working in this business for 20 years now and thanks to the good quality of his products his sales have been very good.  However, due to his informal status, some government agencies are requiring some improvements in food handling techniques in order to continue working in his business.  This is the reason why Raúl hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy a freezer to store his ice and to buy a motor for his cart so that he won’t have to continue pushing it from place to place.

Raúl hopes in this way that he will be able to continue working in his business with improved food handling techniques and to improve his quality of life since he will no longer have to continue pushing his cart.  Also, Raúl hopes that his business will continue generating family income and in the future he dreams with opening a fast-food business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a motor for his cart.

loans.name: Nydia Elena Alzate

texts.es:
Nydia es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se ha esforzado mucho para poder sacar adelante sus 3 hijos en compañía de su esposo. Nydia trabaja como empleada doméstica, sin embargo, decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogo con el cual genera ingresos extras y con los cuales ha podido ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Nydia ha tenido este negocio desde hace ya un tiempo y se encuentra muy agradecida porque este le ha permitido tener muy buena calidad de vida a toda su familia. Con el ánimo de seguir teniendo un buen negocio y seguir aumentando sus ventas, Nydia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un maletín y una vitrina con lo que pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.

Nydia espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y su familia pueda gozar de una buena calidad de vida y sus hijos puedan tener acceso a una educación de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Nydia is a very hardworking person who has always striven very much to be able to move her three children ahead with her husband.  Nydia works as a domestic employee.  However, she decided to set up her own business selling personal use items via catalogue to generate extra income that have allowed her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Nydia has had this business for a time now and she is very grateful because it’s allowed her to have a very good quality of life with her entire family.  Seeking to continue having a good business and continue increasing her sales, Nydia is looking for a loan to buy a satchel and a display case to better display her products.

Nydia hopes in this way that her business will continue growing and that her family will enjoy a good quality of life and that her children will have access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy a satchel and a display case.

loans.name: Monica Patricia Roldan

texts.es:
Monica actualmente trabaja en un casino, donde los horarios de trabajo son muy extremos y esto le ha venido trayendo algunas dificultades emocionales y familiares, por lo que ahora quiere dejar su trabajo y dedicarse a atender un negocio que quiere montar. Monica tiene una amiga que ofrece productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, y ahora que ella le ha enseñado, Monica iniciará su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir y productos de uso personal a través de catálogos. De esta manera, Monica espera trabajar en horarios mucho más cómodos y los cuales le brinden la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y pueda ofrecer una mejor estabilidad familiar. Por esto, Monica busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal y prendas de vestir para comenzar su negocio.

Monica espera cambiar su negocio y seguir teniendo una vida más estable y generando los ingresos con un mejor empleo. Además, Monica espera que de esta manera pueda tener una mejor convivencia con su familia y esto la lleve a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Monica currently works in a casino where work schedules are very extreme and this has been causing her emotional and family problems which is why she wants to leave her job and start tending to a business she wants to start.

Monica has a girlfriend who sells personal use items via catalogue and she’s taught her how.  Monica will start her own business selling clothes and personal use products via catalogues.  In this way, Monica hopes to work much more comfortable work schedules that will allow her to have a better quality of life and family stability.  Because of this Monica is looking for a loan to buy the personal use items and articles of clothing to start her business.

Monica hopes to change her business and start to have a more stable life generating income with a better job.  Also, Monica hopes in this way to have better family relations which will lead to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy personal use items and clothes to start her business.

loans.name: Ashot Khachatryan

texts.en:
Ashot is 55 years old.  He lives in Kapan city, in southern of Armenia, with his wife, son and daughter.  Ashot's son works at the bakery and his wife is a teacher at the local school.  For the past eight years, Ashot has been involved in beekeeping.  His farm currently includes 15 beehives.  In addition to beekeeping, Ashot drives a taxi.
 
Ashot has applied for this loan in order to develop his beekeeping and purchase more beehives.  This will allow him to gather and sell more honey and earn more income.  Ashot dreams to expand his farm beyond beekeeping and develop other fields of agriculture.  Developing his beekeeping business will allow him to start making his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy beehives.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man from Nyahururu.  He has a barber shop that he has been running for the past year.

Peter has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a brand new shaving machine that will allow him serve his clients well.

He hopes to see his business expand and be able to employ one person in the future.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Martha Helena Ruiz

texts.es:
Martha recién separada de su esposo y con 3 hijos a su cargo decidió iniciar su propio negocio y observó que en el sector hacia falta una papelería y servicio de fotocopiadora y así con algunos ahorros y el apoyo de su padre abrió su negocio hace ya 10 años. De esta manera, Martha comenzó a generar los ingresos para su familia y así sus 3 hijos pudieron acceder a tener una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una buena educación. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece en su papelería ha tenido la oportunidad de captar un gran número de clientes que le permite tener muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos servicios a sus clientes, Martha espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un fax y productos de papelería y así seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Martha espera que su negocio siga creciendo y siga teniendo buenos ingresos para sus hijos. Además, Martha espera que su negocio le brinde la oportunidad de tener una mejor estabilidad económica y mayores oportunidades para progresar.
texts.en:
Recently separated from her husband and with three children in her care, Martha decided to start her own business and noted that her neighborhood lacked a stationery shop and photocopying services.  So with some savings she had and with support from her father, she opened her business ten years ago.  In this way, Martha started to generate income for her family and her three children were able to access a good quality of life and a good education.  

Thanks to the good service she offers in her stationery shop, she’s been able to capture a large number of customers which means good sales.  Wanting to continue offering good services to her customers, Martha hopes that a loan will allow her to buy a fax machine and stationery supplies to continue offering a good variety of products to her customers.  

Martha hopes that her business will continue growing and having good income for her children.  Also, Martha hopes that her business will provide the opportunity to have better economic stability and greater opportunities for making progress.

loans.use: to buy a fax machine and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Mishi Fujo

texts.en:
Mishi is 30 years old and the married mother of two children.  She owns a food stall in Kongowea, Mombasa.  Her business has been successfully in operation for the past two years. 

This is her first request for a loan from KADET to finance her business.  She plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business further and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.

loans.name: Meyling Benita

texts.es: Meylin es una joven de 26 años de edad originaria de León, casada, de oficio comerciante, realizo sus estudios hasta 4 grado de primaria, madre de dos hijos. Su actividad la inicio desde hace 2 años en la venta de cerdos debido a que la mama se dedicaba al mismo negocio luego ella comenzó con la crianza de un cerdo y  actualmente cuenta más animales de crianza, recibe el apoyo del esposo que le ayuda con la venta de los cerdos de crianza a los alrededores de su comunidad, tiene como expectativa ampliar la crianza de cerdos para  mejorar  sus condiciones de vida. Realiza el préstamo para la compra de cerdos de desarrollo, insumos tales como concentrado  necesarios para el cuido.
texts.en: Meyling who is 26 years old is originally from León, and married to a merchant. She studied until the 4th grade of primary school. She is the mother of 2 children. She began her activity 2 years ago selling pigs because her mother works in the same business. Later she began by raising one pig and now she has more animals to raise. Her husband helps her sell the pigs to the neighbors in her community. She has as an objective to expand her pig raising business in order to improve her quality of life. With the money from the loan she will buy pigs to raise, and supplies such as animal feed to care for them.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and supplies such as animal feed

loans.name: Marco Aurelio Uribe

texts.es:
Marco es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Marco se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 7 años a quien le quiere brindar una buena calidad de vida y una buena educación. Marco desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de pescados y leche, actividad que aprendió gracias a que su familia, que es bastante numerosa, se dedica a esta actividad y se la enseñaron desde temprana edad. Marco con su trabajo ha venido generando los ingresos que requiere su familia y con esto brinda una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y su hijo, además de que con esto pueden progresar económicamente. Con el ánimo de seguir aumentando sus ventas, Marco busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de pescados y tarros para conservar la leche y ofrecer sus productos a los clientes.

De esta manera Marco seguirá trabajando en su negocio y seguirá generando ingresos para su hogar. Además, Marco espera que su negocio le cumpla el sueño de tener un gran negocio y en un futuro poderse dedicar a las labores del campo.
texts.en:
Marco is a person who has always been known for being a hard worker.  He always wants to offer his family a better quality of life.  Marco is married, and he has a seven year old son.  He wants to give his son a good quality of life and a good education.

For over ten years Marco has been selling fish and milk.  He learned this thanks to his family, which is very large.  His family devotes itself to this business activity, and they taught him at an early age.  With his work Marco has been generating the income that his family needs.  With this he gives his wife and his son a better quality of life.  Also, with this they can make financial progress.

Motivated to continue to increase his sales, Marco looks to a loan.  He will use the loan to buy fish and containers to preserve the milk and to offer his products to the customers.  This is the manner in which Marco will continue working in his business.  He will also continue generating income for his household.  Additionally, Marco hopes that his business will fulfill his dream of having a great business so that in the future he will be able to devote his time to working in the fields.

loans.use: to buy fish and containers to preserve the milk and to offer his products to the customers

loans.name: Claudia Yolima Montoya

texts.es:
Dada la falta de dinero que había en su familia para poder cubrir los gastos que se generan, Claudia decidió colaborar de alguna manera para contribuir económicamente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Fue así como inició su negocio, sin mucho capital pero con muchas ganas de sacarlo adelante, y fue así como empezó a aportar económicamente junto con su esposo para poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Claudia montó su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir donde ofrece a sus clientes ropa interior y ropa informal, gracias a esto ha podido generar unos buenos ingresos con los cuales sus hijos han tenido la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de mejor calidad. En su negocio, Claudia ofrece un muy buen servicio a sus clientes, lo que le ha permitido ganarse su recordación y por tanto crecer cada vez más, y esto es lo que la ha llevado a que pretenda ofrecer ahora una mayor variedad de productos para aumentar sus ventas considerablemente. Es por esto que Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y así aumentar sus ventas considerablemente.

Claudia espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales aumenten y así sus 3 hijos y su esposo puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Claudia sueña con seguir creciendo en el negocio y en un futuro tener un gran negocio el cual sea muy rentable y desde el cual su familia pueda gozar de una estabilidad económica y mayores oportunidades para progresar.
texts.en:
Given her family's lack of money to be able to cover the expenses that it generates, Claudia decided to help in some way, in order to contribute financially to covering the household expenses.

This was how she began her business, without much capital, but with a great desire to have it succeed. This was how she began to contribute financially, together with her husband, to providing her three children with a better quality of life.

Claudia set up her business selling articles of clothing, where she offers her customers underwear and informal clothing. Thanks to this, she has been able to generate a good income, enabling her children to have the opportunity to access better quality education.

In her business, Claudia offers her customers very good service, which has allowed her to earn good revenues and therefore grow even more. This is what has led her to try to now offer a greater variety of products, in order to increase her sales considerably. This is why Claudia is seeking a loan that will  provide her with the chance to purchase articles of clothing, in order to offer her customers a greater variety, and this way increase her sales considerably.

Claudia hopes that this way her monthly income increases, so her three children and her husband can enjoy a better quality of life. In addition, Claudia dreams about continuing to see her business grow, and of having a large business in the future, that will be very profitable, enabling her family to enjoy financial stability and greater opportunities to progress.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing, in order to offer her customers a greater variety, and this way increase her sales considerably.

loans.name: Mariela Nadesca

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela tiene 19 años y es casada pero no tiene por el momento hijos, La Sra. Mariela se dedica a la venta de celulares en una de las calles mas concurridas del centro comercial de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive en la zona 14 de Septiembre. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mariela utilizara  este préstamo  para comprar nuevos celulares para surtir su negocio con variedad de celulares, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar inventario de mercadería. Mariela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el mercado. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en  tener otro puesto de venta, La Sra. Mariela es una persona joven con ganas de superación, emprendedora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mariela is 19 years old. She is married, but currently has no children. Mariela sells cell phones on one of the busiest streets of the commercial area of the city of La Paz. She lives in the September 14th area. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Mariela will use this loan to buy new cell phones to stock her business with a variety of phones. The reason for asking for this loan is to increase merchandise inventory. Mariela faces a challenge in her business, which is the great amount of competition in the market. She is going to use her profits to have another stall. Mariela is a young person with the desire to overcome. She is entrepreneurial and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase new cell phones

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font exclusivement le commerce de poissons frais.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des poissons frais.                                                                          
La cliente ASSA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débout, compte acheter  150 kilos de poissons avec les pêcheurs des villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre sur place à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women who make up the TIESSIRI group are all married.  They are, on average, 35 years old, have four children each, and live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana, neighborhood of Banankabougou.  They know each other through family, friendship and neighborhood ties. They are exclusively involved in selling fresh fish.  This is their second solidarity loan, which will be used to buy fresh fish.

Assa, the first woman standing from the left in the photo, is planning to buy 150 kg of fish from fishermen in nearby villages.  She will then resell these fish locally, from her home, and at the Fana market, for cash or on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

Assa is expecting her average monthly profits to reach 15,000 CFA francs, which will be used, in part, to meet her family's needs, while the rest will be reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Ardon

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es agricultor y junto a él reside en la Comunidad de Las Vegas de Veracruz, en el municipio de Trojes. 

El primer negocio de María Auxiliadora fue la venta de ropa de segunda mano pero desde hace seis años tiene una venta abarrotería en general en su casa de habitación, ella atiende su negocio y su jornada laboral inicia a las 5:00 am y culmina a las 7:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que su casa está a la orilla de la calle y ésta es muy transitada y por eso sus ventas son buenas.

María Auxiliadora solicita este préstamo para surtir su pulpería de más y variados productos como ser lácteos, carnes, verduras, pan, pastas, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, galletas, churros, entre otros productos de uso doméstico como escobas, mechas de trapeador, cloro, azistin, ace, jabon. 

Su sueño es ampliar el inventario de su negocio así como las instalaciones del mismo. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is 38 years old and married with five children.  Her husband is a farmer and they live together in Comunidad de Las Vegas de Veracruz, in the municipality of Trojes. 

María Auxiliadora's first business was selling second-hand clothing, but for six years she has been operationg a general grocery store out of her home.  She works daily at her business from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.   Her major advantage is that her house is on a busy street, so her sales are good.

María Auxiliadora is asking for this loan in order to stock her grocery store with more and varied products such as dairy products, meats, vegetables, bread, pasta, sauces, condiments, refreshments, cookies, churros (baked goods, with similar ingredients to donuts); as well as other domestic products such as brooms, mop heads, bleach, Azistin (a brand of household cleaner), Ace (Proctor & Gamble's Latin American version of Tide), and soap.

Her dream is to increase her business' inventory as well as expand its facilities.  This is her first loan through FAMA and she hopes to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy general groceries.

loans.name: Yesica Senedis Vasquez

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven emprendedora que tiene a su cargo grandes responsabilidades que ha sabido afrontar con gran capacidad. Yesica es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de un hijo de 2 años de edad a quien su padre abandonó desde hace ya un tiempo sin aportar económicamente para su sostenimiento. Dada esta situación, Yesica se vio en la obligación de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar y fue así como inició la venta de productos de uso personal, aprovechando que su madre se dedica a esta actividad y se la enseñó inmediatamente. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Yesica a sus clientes, ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes para su negocio rápidamente, de modo que ahora tiene clientes en diferentes sectores de su municipio que a menudo hasta se hace difícil ofrecer los productos e ir y hacer la entrega de los mismos en el momento de la venta. Con el ánimo de mejorar esta situación, Yesica ha venido ahorrando dinero para comprarse una moto, de lo cual ya tiene aproximadamente el 75% del valor de la moto ahorrado, y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a completar el dinero que le hace falta para comprarse una moto y poder atender los clientes que viven en diferentes sectores de su municipio. 

Yesica espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumentaran considerablemente, pues tendrá la oportunidad de atender clientes que antes debía dejar de lado por el difícil acceso en el transporte. Además, Yesica espera que con mayores ingresos su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas en su vida para progresar.
texts.en:
Yesica is an enterprising young woman who has great responsibilities that she has known how to face with great ability.  Yesica is a single mother and the head of the family.  She has a two year old son whose father abandoned him some time ago.  The father does not contribute to financially supporting their son.

Given this situation Yesica saw the necessity of generating the income needed to support her household.  That is how she started selling personal use products.  She took advantage of the fact that her mother devotes herself to this business activity, and her mother taught her immediately.

Thanks to the good service that Yesica gives her customers, she has managed to rapidly gain a large number of customers for her business.  As a result she now has customers in different sectors of her municipality.  This often makes it difficult for her to to offer the products and go to deliver them at the time of the sale.  

With the intention to improve this situation, Yesica has been saving money to buy a motorcycle.  She has already saved approximately 75% of the cost of the motorcycle.  That is why she seeks a loan for the money that she lacks to buy a motorcycle.  With a motorcycle she will be able to tend to the customers who live in different sectors of her municipality.

Yesica hopes that this way her says will increase considerably.  She will have the opportunity to tend to customers who she previously had to put aside because of the difficulty of accessing transportation.  Also, Yesica hopes the with greater income her son will be able to have a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to advance in his life.

loans.use: to have the money she needs (she has saved 75%) to buy a motorcycle to be able to tend to the customers who live in different sectors of her municipality.

loans.name: Merdeka Utara 2 Group

texts.en: Tanisem started her business selling cookies in 2002. She opened a small kiosk in front of her house. From her business, she can create extra income to supplement the income her husband earns as a fisherman to pay for her children's school fee. Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more ingredients and produce more snacks to sell as ordered. She also wants to buy more kitchen tools and cooking tools to help her produce more snacks to sell. In the future, she wants to produce more variety of snacks to sell. She hopes she can get more customers.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and tools to produce snacks

loans.name: Celia Sabas Rivas Mejia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad donde alberga la mayor población afroperuana de nuestro país y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don particular, cocinan de manera deliciosa y sobre todo son personas muy carismáticas y amables.  Celia vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad, ella lo ama mucho y es su razón de vivir y el mejor motivo para salir adelante y ser mejor cada día a pesar de las adversidades. Cuando Dispone de un tiempo libre Celia dedica ese tiempo a su familia y en especial conversar con su hijo o salir a pasear; asimismo le encanta cocinar y sobre todo preparar uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Día a Día Celia trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y venta de comida; ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día en ambos negocios, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene una buena sazón en la preparación de los platillos.

Celia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayudad que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de abarrotes, en especial bebidas gaseosas, jugos, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y que sea un complemento de su negocio de comida; asi ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realizad su gran sueño: “Tener una gran tienda e iniciar otros negocios,  darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Celia is 35 years old. She lives in the city of Chincha, a city which harbors the largest Afro-Peruvian population of our country and is the cradle of great glories of the Peruvian  sports. The residents also have a particular gift: they cook in a delicious way, and above all they are very charismatic and friendly people.

Celia lives with her husband and little son who is 10 years old. She loves him very much and he is her reason to live and her biggest reason to get ahead and to become better every day despite adversity. When she has free time Celia likes to spend the time with her family and she especially enjoys conversing with her son or taking a walk. She also likes to cook and above all to prepare one of her favorite dishes which is the tasty Lomo Saltado (a Peruvian dish with Asian influence made with strips of beef, onions, rice and french fries).

Day by day Celia sells groceries and food. She works about 12 hours per day in the two businesses. She believes that her business is going well because she is friendly towards clients and above all because she prepares her dishes with a good seasoning.

Celia is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help that has been given to her she can buy merchandise for her grocery store, especially soft drinks, juices, rice, sugar, and other items, which permit her to have a better variety of products and to have a supplement to her food business, so she will continue working in order to obtain her big dream: “To have a big store and begin other businesses, and to give her children a profession.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Merdeka Utara 7 Group

texts.en: Erma has been selling clothes and electronic goods on credit since 2006. She goes around her environment to ask her neighbors whether they need clothes or electronic goods but can not buy it with cash. If so, she will help them by providing the items and her customer will pay her on credit. Now she has a lot of customers. This time she plans to use her part of the loan to buy four televisions that were ordered by her customers. She likes to run this business because she can still have more time at home to take care of her children who are still in school. With her income, she can help her husband, who works as a driver in the port, to have extra income to pay their children's school fees. In the future, she wants to expand her business and hopefully get more customers.

loans.use: to pay for televisions to sell on credit

loans.name: Adiso

texts.en:
Adiso is a 26-year-old bachelor from Bat Yam who runs a store in Rishon Letzion and is expanding to include a small restaurant. Adiso opened his neighborhood store and began selling supplies to other area restaurants with much success. After researching a new restaurant’s potential, costs and demand in his area, he is now expanding his business to include a small restaurant. Adiso tried to gain credit through normal banking channels but due to his lack of banking history and inherent unfriendliness to the very small businesses, his only avenue to expand his current business is through a direct loan.

Adiso needs this loan to renovate and to purchase restaurant furniture and supplies.

Adiso wants to see his business grow and one day support additional employees, ensuring a secure future for himself and his future family.

loans.use: to renovate and to purchase restaurant furniture and supplies.

loans.name: Mary Gabriel

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in this business for two years. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth Nyokabi

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old from Olkalou and is married to Moses. They have three children between the ages of 15 and 20 years old.

Elizabeth is a farmer and has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy potato seeds and four bags of fertilizer. She is planning to cultivate a two-acre piece of land.

She hopes to start a wholesale business of selling clothes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shaken

texts.ru:
Шакен 59 лет, вдова, имеет 1 сына. С 2010 года Шакен занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 21,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Шакен имеется  2 дойные коровы и 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет примерно 6,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шакен обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Шакен планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Shaken is fifty-nine years old, widowed and has one child. In 2010 Shaken began an animal breeding business from a starting capital of 21,000 soms. Currently, she holds two milking cows and two horses; her monthly revenue from meat and milk product sales is around 6,000 soms. Earning to expand her business even further, Shaken approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" requesting a loan of 50,000 soms to purchase some additional livestock. 
She plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Al-Rwid Group

texts.en:
This group is called AL-RWID. It is made up of five women, Khadigh, Roma, Saeedh, Fatima and Zainb, who are neighbors from Aden, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 250,000 YER

Saeedh is the group's leader (in the photo, she is the second woman from right wearing a blue scarf). She is 39 years old, married and has four children. She has had business selling new clothing and incense for six years. One of Saeedh's goals is to continue to grow her business. She wants to become a businesswoman. She lives with her family. She stocks fabric, robes and dresses to sell to her clients. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracted more clients, which helped her business to continue successfully running and made the business more profitable. Recently, she took out a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses and reselling them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, skirts and dresses to sell

loans.name: Zipporah Mwangi

texts.en:
Zipporah is 26 years old from Njabini and is married with one daughter, who is six years old.

Zipporah is a farmer and has been in it for the past 10 years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for her farm.

She hopes to get enough capital in the future to enable her to start a green grocer. She is also dedicated to giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides

loans.name: Yomina Gordon

texts.en:
Yomina lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Yomina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old and married to John. They have five school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last eight years.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her sixth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Veronica Borete

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children; all of whom are still in school. 

Veronica heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Makali Kafutya Kavuu

texts.en: Makali is 51 years old, married and has 8 children. He runs a retail shop and sells charcoal to earn a living. He has been in the business for 34 years and employs one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his retail shop to a wholesale shop in the future. He has applied for a 60,000 Kenya Shillings loan to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Mary Luka

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children; all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор 1947 года рождения, он женат имеет 3 сыновей. Он работает таксистом, Абдукахор по городу развозит пассажиров. Он работает таксистом 12 лет.  Его жена сидит дома, она пенсионерка. В этом году он планирует поехать с женой лечиться  на берегу моря в санаторий. Кредит получает в первые в нашей организации.
texts.en: Abdukahor was born in 1947, he's married and has three sons. He's worked as a taxi driver for the last twelve years. Abdukahor's wife is retired. They plan to travel this year to a sanatorium for treatment. This is the first time he's asked for a loan from this organization.

loans.use: to purchase a trip to the sanatorium

loans.name: Hamit

texts.ru: Хамит трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двух сыновей и одну дочку. Супруга домохозяйка. Более 5 лет Хамит занимается предоставлением услуг такси. Его сын, также занимается этим бизнесом и помогает отцу для содержания семьи. Хамит очень старается улучшить жилищные условия семьи и расширить свой бизнес. Хамит хотел бы получить займ для покупки автомобиля марки «Опель» для своего сына на предоставление услуг такси, с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Hamit is hardworking and driven. He's married, has two sons and a daughter. His wife takes care of their household. 
For the last five years, Hamit has made a living working as a taxi driver. One of his sons also drives a taxi and helps support the family. Hamit's goal is to increase his family's quality of life and expand his business. He asks for a loan in order to purchase an Opel for his son, allowing the later to to help him with work. Hamit hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is 49 years old. He lives in Sana'a. He is married and has eight children. He has been operating an old corn grinder for many years. He started his business because it has fast sales in the market and is attractive to business partners. He is an incredibly hardworking man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, it is the only source of his income. On the other hand, through lots of effort, he has managed to grind his customer's grain, i.e., he provides them a service to put food on the table. Recently, he says that the main challenge to his business is a seasonal problem: during the dry season this type of product is very expensive. So, Mohammed took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grain for his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business to have an extra mill store because his region is lacking some services, which he could supply to solve people's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grains for his business

loans.name: Grace B

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hillary Serem

texts.en:
Hillary is a married man aged 39 years old and blessed with five children aged between 15 and five years old. He owns a restaurant in Kilibwoni and has been in operation for a period of nine years earning  a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is his third loan and he wishes to use the amount to purchase a television for his business. 

This will entertain customers. The profits will be used to plough back into the business. He hopes to improve in business and improve living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a television for his business.

loans.name: Linet Ombisi

texts.en:
Linet is a 25-year-old business lady who sells shoes in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of one and has been selling shoes for the past ten years with success.
 
This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more stock of shoes to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shoes

loans.name: Mayerlin Mancilla Quintero

texts.es: Mayerlin de 23 años  es la propietaria de una panadería ubicada en su barrio, de la ciudad de Cartagena. Ella inició con este negocio hace 4 años cuando con su familia llegó a esta ciudad desplazada y con poco capital. Como conocían este negocio decidieron emprenderlo y ahora es un gran apoyo a los ingresos familiares pues de ello dependen. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio generar mayores ingresos, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder a sus expectativas de crecimiento.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará harina de trigo, azúcar, grasas e insumos varios, de contado y en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos, un poco mas de dinero y aumentar su producción y esto es lo que hace que la inversión  sea exitosa, además de que,  con el delicioso aroma que se extiende durante el proceso, su clientela comprará todo lo que prepare su panadería y Mayerlin puede repetir el adagio popular que dice: "se vende todo como pan caliente", para indicar que la rotación de un producto es efectiva.
texts.en:
Mayerlin is 23 years old. She is the owner of a bakery located in her neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena. She began this business 4 years ago when her family arrived in the city displaced and with little capital. Since she knew this business she decided to undertake it and now it is a big help to the family income upon which they depend.

Her goal going forward is to have her own facility to generate better income, but her working capital is insufficient to meet her anticipated growth. Currently she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy flour, sugar, fats and various supplies, paying in cash and in greater volume to get a discount, plus a little bit of money to expand her production and this is how she will use the investment successfully. As well, with the delicious aroma that spreads out during the process, her customers will buy everything she prepares in her bakery and Mayerlin can repeat the popular proverb: “everything is selling like hot cakes,” indicating that things are moving along effectively.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, fats and miscellaneous supplies, paying in cash and in greater volume to get a discount

loans.name: Alsla Group

texts.en:
This group is called ALSLA. It consists of three members:  Aisha, Razgy and Aisha who reside in the same area. They live in Hodiedah, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from AMB to boost their business. They have requested a loan of 120,000 YER.

The group's representative, Aisha, is the one in the photo standing in the centre. She is 35 years old and married with six children. Aisha lives together with her husband and children. She began her business when her husband got sick. She works to cover the different household expenses. 

To help meet the different needs of the family, she has been selling ladies clothes for many years. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from the city market. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy ladies fabrics, perfumes, etc.

She hopes to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ladies fabrics and incense to sell

loans.name: Joice Isimal

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 40 year old, single, and has no children.

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Moses Ndungu Njoroge

texts.en: Moses is 27 years old and married with one child.  He sells motor vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many customers who visit him regularly. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Flora Movlaeva

texts.en:
Flora is 54 years old. She lives in a village of Gardabani District, East Georgia. Flora is married and lives with her family - her husband, Massim, their two children (10 and 9 years old),  and her mother-in-law. Flora works as a nurse in the village. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in a family agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for the family. In particular, the family has a small dairy farm with three milk cows. Flora produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also, she grows greens on a family-owned plot of land. Harvested greens are sold to local green grocer retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris.

Flora requested credit for purchasing an additional two milk cows. She will increase production and sale of cheese by 60% and the income of the family will increase on average by 300 Laris. She will use the increased income for purchasing additional household goods for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Robert Maoja

texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old, from Nyahururu, and has a son who is two years old.

Robert is a tailor by profession and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more clothing materials to add to his stock. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials to add to his stock

loans.name: Helena Jeremia

texts.en:
Helena is a 47-year-old green grocer in Voi. She is married and a mother of four children. She has been selling groceries for the past four years with great success. 

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, and green maize. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, and green maize

loans.name: Jane Musembi

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married with seven grown-up children. 

Jane is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more materials and bed covers to add to her stock. She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a staff member.

She hopes to have an established place to do her business instead of hawking.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and bed covers to sell

loans.name: Wardh

texts.en:
Wardh is a 37-year-old woman who is married and a mother of three children. She lives in Hadramout, Yemen. She got start-up capital for her business by selling her gold jewelry to open a beauty salon for women, with the expectation that she would be able to meet her own needs and her children's. She tirelessly worked in her salon and attracted new clientele to the extent that she hired another woman to help her. Her living conditions improved and so did her income. 

The expansion of Wardh's clientele made her in need of funding to purchase more beauty supplies.  Now she has taken out her  loan amounting to 100,000 Rials from AMB in order to purchase more beauty supplies like shampoos, creams and also mirrors for her salon. In the future, Wardh intends to expand her business further and hire another woman to replace her. She is also saving for her children in order to enroll them in a private school.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty supplies like shampoos, creams and also mirrors for her salon

loans.name: Samuel Nderitu

texts.en:
Samuel is 31 years old, from Nakuru, and married with two children who are in school.

Samuel has a clothing business that he has been doing for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more clothes for sale. 

He hopes to open a shopping mall for new clothes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mealii Mwalele

texts.en:
Mealii is a 52-year-old rental house owner in Miritini, Mombasa. She is married. She has been a landlady for the past twelve years and she is doing great.

This marks her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase iron sheets, bricks, and cement to construct more houses for rent. 

She will use the anticipated profits to renovate her houses and repay her loan. She hopes to have numerous rental houses in Miritini.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, bricks, and cement to construct more houses for rent

loans.name: Mikheil Sisauri

texts.en:
Mikheil is 31 years old. He lives in a village of Gardabani District with his family - his wife (Nina), parents, younger brother, and grandmother (retired). The family earns a living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with two milk cows and three calves. Mikheil sells milk, as well as homemade cheese, produced by his mother. Along with the agriculture, Mikheil also works as a night-watch at a local company. The total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris, including the pension of Mikheil’s grandma. 

Mikheil requested credit for purchasing a plot of land. He will cultivate it and sow vegetables, such as corn. Mikheil will sell the harvested products locally to green grocers and product wholesalers. The income of the family will increase. Mikheil plans to make some savings from the increased income, as he wants to build a separate house in the same village, where he will live with his wife and children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Nazi Mwango

texts.en:
Nazi is a 39-year-old business lady in Kilifi who sells cashew nuts. She has been doing this business for the past three years successfully. Nazi is married and a mother of four.

This marks her third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more cashew nuts for sale to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts

loans.name: Gilford Onyamwembe

texts.en:
Gilford is 64 years old, from Olkalou, and is married with two children who are in school.

Gilford is a farmer and has been in it for the past 10 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for his farm.

He hopes to get enough capital in the future to enable him to buy more cows and sheep, and venture into cattle rearing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Jane Martim

texts.en:
Jane is married with four children between the ages of five and 13.  

She has been in this business for one year, and she hopes to expand it with this loan which she will use to buy more produce.  She would like to grow her business enough to provide a stable income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Naomi Njoki

texts.en:
Naomi is 39 years old and married to Francis. Together they have three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and maize seedlings  for planting.

She hopes to diversify and start a zero-grazing unit.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Souza

texts.en:
Souza, age 40, is married with 2 children who both attend school. She also cares and provides for 3 other family members who cannot support themselves. She has a shop in a local market where she sells bags and other women's items. She will use the loan to buy bags, purses, bras, and nail polish. 

Souza has had this business for 25 years! She has been able to acquire many loyal customers and knows many people in the community. 

Souza has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. She hopes to one day build a free-standing boutique for her business. As her business continues to grow, Souza wants to help her children complete their education and hopefully study abroad.

loans.use: to pay for bags, bras, and nail polish to sell in her shop

loans.name: Mary Njoroge

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is a single mother to four children who are all in school.

Mary has a grocery business that she has been running for the past 19 years and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more carrots, potatoes, and beans for sale in her business.

She hopes to start farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, potatoes, and beans

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La Srta. Alejandrina es soltera, tiene 19  años de edad, Alejandrina  estudia enfermería en un instituto de prestigio, Alejandrina  escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y es muy solidaria  además tiene  habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente en la medicina, actualmente Alejandrina  trabaja en una tienda de zapatos como vendedora para poder pagar sus estudios,  con el fin de seguir creciendo Alejandrina  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar matrícula y pensión   , Alejandrina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Miss Alejandrina is single and 19 years old.  Alejandrina studies Nursing in a prestigious institute.  Alejandrina chose this career since it is her calling and is very supportive.  Furthermore, she has skills to develop herself professionally in medicine.

Currently Alejandrina works in a shoe store as a salesperson to be able to pay for her studies. In order to continue growing Alejandrina is requesting a new loan to pay for enrollment and board.  Alejandrina will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort and Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment and board

loans.name: Esiebo Elizabeth

texts.en:
Esiebo, age 48, is married with three children. Her youngest child is 15, and her oldest child is 25. All three of her children are attending school. She sells CD's in a local market in Brazzaville. Esiebo will use the loan to buy more CD's to stock her shelves.

She has had this business for fifteen years and has gained many valuable customers over the years. Her business strategy is to negotiate well with her customers and offer competitive prices.
 
Esiebo has had three previous loans with Kiva's partner HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record, and she hopes to one day be able to travel abroad to buy merchandise for her business. She knows she can get better prices and a larger variety of CD's from outside of Brazzaville.

loans.use: to buy CD's to sell in her business.

loans.name: Korotemassigui Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires, les sept femmes du groupe Korotemassigui ont  en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des habillements, des condiments alimentaires, des céréales et de la  restauration. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui, elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Kiatou ( 2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est la vendeuse d’habillements de toutes qualités du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax après des grossistes du marché de Ségou. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile et au marché. Avec ce prêt, Kiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in nuclear families, the seven women of the group Korotemassigui average 43 years of age and five children each. The women all live in Ségou City and know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They buy and sell clothing, condiments, and grain, and they work in food service.

Concerned about meeting the needs of their demanding and burgeoning customer base, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

Kiatou (2nd woman standing from right to left in the photo) is the one in the group who sells all qualities of clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy 15 lengths of Wax <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth) from wholesalers from the Ségou market. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail out of her home and at the market to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Kiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Carlos Antonio Delgado Tobar

texts.es:
carlos de 40 años vive ( playa Ecuador ).desde muy joven aprendió a confeccionar ropa. Poco a poco fue incursionando en la sastrería hasta llega a tener su taller. 

Inicio su negocio con una máquina de coser y aprendió poco a poco la costura mediante de pedidos.  Pero para generar más ingresos él comenzó a trabajar en una compañía de seguro. Pero en los horarios que no trabaja en la compañía se dedica a la confección de ropa.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar (telas, hilos).
texts.en: Carlos is 40 years old and lives in Playas, Ecuador.  He learned how to make clothes when he was very young.  Little by little, he worked in tailoring until he was able to have his own shop.  He started his business with a sewing machine and learned sewing little by little through the orders.   In order to make more income, he started to work with an insurance company.  But when he's not working at the company, he makes clothes.  He has a lot of dreams for his business and that is why he wants the loan, to buy fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabrica and thread.

loans.name: Cecilia Martir Juanazo Bermello

texts.es: cecilia  vive ( paraíso guayaquil ). Ella empezó su negocio de vender perfumes de Yambal hace tres años . el motivo de escoger este negocio  es porque su esposo la abandono .y para poder sustentar a sus hijos decidió vender Yambal. Ella trabaja con muchas ganas y esfuerzo todos los días de 8:00 a 18:00. A futuro ella anhela mejorara su negocio y su situación económica. Con el préstamo comprara ( joyas perfumes etc).
texts.en: Cecilia lives in El Paraíso in  Guayaquil. She started her business selling perfume from Yanbal three years ago. The reason she chose this business is because her husband left her and to support her children, she decided to sell Yanbal. She works with a lot of enthusiasm and dedication every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and her financial situation. With the loan she will buy jewelry, perfume, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes.
